name: Emoji
comment:
This library is for conveniently supporting
[emoji](http://unicode.org/emoji/charts/full-emoji-list.html) in Elm
applications.

There is a high-level drop-in replacement for `Html.text` which has to make
some extra assumptions about the app, and customizable mapping over emojis.


# The high level

@docs text_


# Customizable

@docs textWith, replaceWithEmojiOne, replaceWithTwemoji

values.name: replaceWithEmojiOne
values.comment: Turn an emoji unicode sequence into an `` pointing at [EmojiOne](http://emojione.com/), with classes `elm-emoji-img` and `elm-emoji-one`. text' : String -> Html a text' = textWith replaceWithEmojiOne >> span [ class "elm-emoji" ]

values.name: replaceWithTwemoji
values.comment: Convert an emoji unicode sequence into a [Twemoji](http://twitter.github.io/twemoji/) `` tag. It will have CSS classes `elm-emoji-img` and `elm-emoji-twem`. text' : String -> Html a text' body = span [] (textWith replaceWithTwemoji body)

values.name: textWith
values.comment:
Create a customized emoji converter. The function argument maps emoji
(identified by the lowercase hex-encoded unicode code point sequence) to
Html nodes.

    mapEmoji : List String -> Html a
    mapEmoji codePoints =
        text ("(I'm code " ++ (String.join "-" codePoints) ++ ")")

    div []
        ( textWith mapEmoji "here's a penguin:ðŸ§" )
values.type: (List.List String.String -> Html.Html a) -> String.String -> List.List (Html.Html a)

values.name: text_
values.comment: Convert a String with unicode emoji characters into an Html element containing the text with `` tags replacing the emojis. This function produces a `` containing the text, replacing emojis with `` tags pointing to CDN-hosted [EmojiOne](http://emojione.com/). div [] [ text' "Live long and prosper ðŸ––" ]
